alert.note: Alert for Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Pocahontas; Southeast Raleigh; Southeast Webster (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 21 at 8:47PM EST until December 22 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 1 PM EST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, freezing rain expected. Total ice accumulations of around two tenths of an inch. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills with wind gusts greater than 40 mph possible. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...Southeast Raleigh, Southeast Fayette, Southeast Nicholas, Southeast Webster and Southeast Pocahontas Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 1 AM to 1 PM EST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Watch, from late Thursday night through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 20 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. Additional information can be found at https://www.weather.gov/rlx as well as on our Facebook and Twitter pages.

area.areaDesc: Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Pocahontas; Southeast Raleigh; Southeast Webster
